list.text: COMMENT: Long-run average costs for Quasilinear PF are only calculated when alpha=beta
Type of production function: 1 for Cobb-Douglas production function, 2 for perfect substitutes and 3 for fixed-proportions - now complete for CB
Production function parameters:
For CobbDouglas PF defined above MC in short run is \frac{w}{1-\alpha} \frac{Q}{K}^\frac{\alpha}{1-\alpha}. Solution for MC=P in terms of L is defined below:
This is solution of Q=f(K,L_sr(K)): a function which defines optimal capital level along the LR expansion curve
2nd option of production f-n:
This is solution of Q=f(K,L_sr(K)): a function which defines optimal capital level along the LR expansion curve. Only for alpha=beta!
For QuasiLinear PF defined above MC in short run is \frac{w}{\alpha A}[\frac{Q}{A}-K^beta]^\frac{1-alpha}{alpha}=\frac{w}{\alpha A}L^{1-\alpha}. Solution for MC=P in terms of L is defined below:
Below define universal f-ns for production function, MRTS and SR and LR solutions:
